intro: Calycomorphum globosum, commonly known as the globular calycomorph, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact, spherical shape and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Calycomorphum globosum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
